body_html:
Hi,

I have the same error message

cuda runtime error (35) : CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version at ..\aten\src\THC\THCGeneral.cpp:74

and tried to fix it further your comments above:

conda uninstall cuda90 cuda91 cuda92 pytorch -y

Then again:

conda install pytorch cuda92 -c pytorch

(Torchivsion is already installed: Torchvision v0.2.1 )

But I have the same error message coming back.

My configuration is:

  • OS: Windows 10 Pro 64bit (10.0, Build 17134)
  • Python version: 3.6.6
  • GPU: Intel(R) HD Graphics 620
  • Versions of relevant libraries:
    numpy (1.15.1)
    numpydoc (0.8.0)
    torchvision (0.2.1)
    matplotlib 2.2.3

I look forward reading your comments and thank you for your feedback

body:
Hi, 

I have the same error message

> cuda runtime error (35) : CUDA driver version is insufficient for CUDA runtime version at ..\aten\src\THC\THCGeneral.cpp:74

and tried to fix it further your comments above:

`conda uninstall cuda90 cuda91 cuda92 pytorch -y`

Then again: 

`conda install pytorch cuda92 -c pytorch`
 
(Torchivsion is already installed: Torchvision v0.2.1 <pip>)

But I have the same error message coming back. 

My configuration is:

- OS: Windows 10 Pro 64bit (10.0, Build 17134)
- Python version: 3.6.6
- GPU: Intel(R) HD Graphics 620
- Versions of relevant libraries:
numpy (1.15.1)
numpydoc (0.8.0)
torchvision (0.2.1)
matplotlib 2.2.3

I look forward reading your comments and thank you for your feedback
